page.title: 06ST.DAVID'S CHURCH TON/GELLI
page.content: Before 1860 the Rhondda Valley was sparsely populated. Then coal was struck and people came from everywhere to work here. There was only one church in the Ton and Gelli Area, which was called St.Johns. Because it was built near a river every winter it flooded so marriages and funerals could not take place. In 1880 the ground to build a new church on a hill by Crawshay Bailey, who owned the local collieries, was laid at a cost of Â£4000. The opening ceremony took place in 1881. The Church was built with soft Bath Stone which does not last and the Church needed repair in 1900. Now the Church requires so much repair work the cost would be enormous, so it is decided that the Church will close this year, 1985,and a new St.John Baptist Church will be built at a cost of Â£100,000
